intro: Pedicularis ochiaiana, commonly known as the Japanese lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its hemiparasitic nature, meaning it partially relies on host plants for nutrients. The plant produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas with acidic soils. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
